main event: On July 18, 1956, a bright, tear-shaped object with orange and green lights was observed drifting over Arkansas City, Kansas for about 40 minutes.
interesting points: Witnesses included a city editor and a trooper who were alerted by radio about an unidentified target detected on radar., The object was described as being at an altitude of 5 to 6000 feet and was first seen at an azimuth of 80 degrees., Local winds at the time corresponded to the object's drift, suggesting it might have been a balloon., The object faded away after moving across a wide area of the sky., Multiple authorities, including the Air Force, investigated the sighting but attributed it to possible balloons or gas torches.
witness description: a city editor, a trooper from the Kansas State Highway Patrol, and an Arkansas City police officer
